entry.title: Help Needed : Your apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I recently received a notification from Google Play stating that my apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements.

Here is the message from Google Play :

3 of your apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements
" To ensure that your app works correctly on the latest versions of Android, Google Play requires all apps targeting Android 15+ to support 16 KB memory page sizes.

From 1 May 2026, if your app updates do not support 16 KB memory page sizes, you won't be able to release these updates. "

Could someone guide me on this?

Thank you,

entry.title: SAC Table - Measures disappear after setting dimension filter even though there is data
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

in SAC I have a table with the dimension "Company" in rows as well as the date and multiple measures in the columns.

Without any filters applied you can see that there is data for all measures for one company. However, when I set a filter on this Company (either via Story filter or filter inside the chart) all the measures disappear from the table. See screenshots attached.

I would expect the one row to be displayed with the measures. It works in other tables, just not this one.

Info:

  • I set all zeros and nulls to be shown in the table settings.
  • The source of the data model is Datasphere. When I preview the data there, I can see the measures for this company and can set a filter

Thank you for your help!

Regards

Maike

entry.title: Preliminary What’s New Information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1
entry.content:
Preliminary version of What’s New information and of the Product Assistance are now available for customers and partners to get a preview on the upcoming new and changed features of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1.

You can find this preview on the current SAP Help Portal page SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (see What’s New section “Preview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1”). To access the Preliminary What’s New information, please use the What’s New Viewer or the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool.

The RASD tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What’s New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The preliminary information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 will be available in RASD within the next few days. We recommend using RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you. A valid S-User ID is needed to use the RASD tool and to view all the preliminary content stated above.

For any feedback you may have, try the Commenting Feature for What's New documentation in this release. See this blog for more information.

entry.title: Re: What professional challenge or hiccup have you learned the most from?
entry.content:
I believe some of my biggest learnings were very early in my career. I was an apprentice and had to send out event invitations (on paper) to car dealers, who would forward them to their customers. I finished the assignment before going on vacation. When I came back, the team told me that I sent the email invitations from the year before. My boss took the blame and sent out the correct versions in a night shift, while I was out. I felt so embarrassed and sorry. Looking back, I never made that mistake again and learned some valuable lessons: 

  1. Watch out for the details. Triple check your messages - especially externally.
  2. Clean up and stay organized. The old invitations should have been in the trash - besides maybe one sample - and not in the shelf for our current materials. The new invitations should have been in that shelf instead of in the mail room.
  3.  A strong leader steps up for his team members and supports if something goes wrong.

entry.title: Introducing Reporting Scope and Data Collection in SAP Sustainability Control Tower
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog post reflects the state of the SAP Sustainability Control Tower as of September 1st, 2025.

Why SAP Developed Reporting Scope and Data Collection

SAP introduced the Reporting Scope and Data Collection feature in Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) to address the challenges organizations face when manually collecting sustainability data. Many customers struggled with decentralized, manual processes – often relying on emails and spreadsheets – which made it difficult to ensure data quality, traceability, and compliance with regulatory requirements. The new feature provides an integrated, workflow-based solution that guides users through the process, ensures relevant KPIs are collected, and supports collaboration between central and local teams. 

What Does the Feature Do?

The Reporting Scope and Data Collection feature enables organizations to:

  • Define which sustainability metrics are relevant for reporting.
  • Configure how data should be collected and who is responsible.
  • Guide users through a structured, form-based workflow for data entry, review, and approval.
  • Track and manage data collection runs for different reporting periods.
  • Ensure data is captured, approved, and stored in a traceable manner. 

Step-by-Step Guide: SAP SCT Applications

  1. Manage Reporting Scope
  • Define the scope of sustainability reporting by selecting relevant metrics and organizational boundaries.
  • Set validity dates and add comments for each metric (e.g., materiality, monitoring purposes).
  • Capture the results of double materiality assessments and specify which KPIs require data collection.
  • In this simplified example the organizational boundary is set to Business Region EMEA and the Scope Items are the ESRS items Total energy consumption related to own operations - E1-5 - (37)(AR 35) and Total water consumption - E3-4 - (28a).

  1. Configure Data Collection
  • Assign data processors and approvers for each scoped metric and organizational entity.
  • Choose the data collection method (e.g., workflow-based).
  • Ensure responsibilities are clear for each data point to streamline collaboration

  1. Configure Data Entry
  • Customize the data entry form for each metric, including the data collection cycle (e.g., monthly, quarterly or yearly) and required breakdowns by a master data dimension.
  • Add instructions and enable relevant dimensions to guide processors during data entry

  1. Manage Data Collection Instances
  • Set up data collection runs for specific reporting years and periods.
  • Define start, submission, and approval dates to control the workflow timeline.
  • Generate forms for each reporting period and metric, ensuring timely data collection. 

  1. Manage Data Collection Forms
  • Preview and send out data collection forms to assigned processors.
  • Processors enter data and submit for approval; approvers review, approve, or reject submissions.
  • Approved data is published and stored, with full traceability in SCT. 

 

This new workflow-based approach in SAP SCT streamlines sustainability data collection, improves data quality, and supports compliance with evolving regulatory standards.

Feature status and outlook: Currently, the feature supports quantitative metrics and measures for sustainability reporting. In future iterations, SAP plans to include qualitative metrics and basic custom metrics, as well as additional data entry methods, plausibility checks, multi-step approvals and email notifications based on customer feedback.

For further support, please also visit Data Collection Workflow for Quantitative Metrics | SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Features & functions of app Cash Flow Analyzer (F2332) in S/4HANA Cash and Liquidity Management.
entry.content:
Hello and welcome to the blog post for the app Cash Flow Analyzer (F2332). This blog post is about the app Cash Flow Analyzer (CFA) in S/4HANA Cash Management. My goal here is to provide some insight about this app and explain some features provided by the app. 

Some other blogs posted by me for Cash and Liquidity Management:

1. Flow Builder Plus - benefits, basic details, configurations, etc 

Flow Builder Plus - benefits, basic details, confi... - SAP Community
2. Liquidity Assignment for SO, MM, FI and Treasury in S/4 HANA Cash ManagementLiquidity Assignment for SO, MM, FI and Treasury i... - SAP Community
3. Snapshot, common recommendations, helpful tipsSnapshot - how it works? - SAP Community


Some basic information about the app Cash Flow Analyzer:

  • App Cash Flow Analyzer takes all the data to be displayed from the one exposure table FQM_FLOW. The table FQM_FLOW is updated when
    • For FI and MM, the flow builder report FCLM_FLOW_BUILDER (till S4CORE 105) and report FCLM_FLOW_BUILDER_2 (S4CORE 106 onwards) is processed.
    • For TRM, CML, SD and Payment Request, the report FQM_INITIALIZE is processed.
  • There is no need to execute the flow builder report or report FQM_INITIALIZE manually every day to update the one exposure table. 
  • There are some prerequisites that should be checked if the data is not updated in table FQM_FLOW. See KBA 3595016 - No Flows Generated by FCLM_FLOW_BUILDER_2 in SAP S/4HANA – Troubleshooting Guide, for details.
  • Cash Flow Analyzer app displays the aggregated data and Check Cash Flow Items displays the data at line-item level.
  • To avoid giving same values in the selection filters or selecting the column displays of Cash Flows again and again, variants can be saved in the Cash Flow Analyzer app. The variant can be used to access the saved changes whenever needed.

Why Cash Flow Analyzer?

  • The app Cash Flow Analyzer provides us the comprehensive view of the Cash Position and Liquidity Analysis data.
  • This app gives more flexibility to display the data. You can analyze cash flows for days, weeks, months, or years for all bank accounts and liquidity items. You also have the option to use multiple hierarchies.
  • You have the option to create and save your own variants, layouts, and filters based on your specific needs.
  • See the SAP help guide for more details.

Details about some selection fields:

  1. Display currency and Exchange rate:
    • The app displays amounts in Transaction Currency and Bank Account Currency.
    • Transaction currency amount is taken directly from FQM_FLOW, but not for bank account currency/Display currency, therefore, need to convert transaction currency to bank account currency/display currency.
    • When any currency is selected in the Display Currency, it is mandatory to give the Exchange Rate Type also. The amount is then displayed in the Display currency after converting it using the exchange rate type.
    • The app always uses today’s exchange rate with given Exchange Rate Type in selection to convert the currency.

      Display Currency and Exchange Rate

  2. Scope for FI:
    • This option is available in the newer releases. This field provides the option to select what type of data you want to display in the app.
    • If the Liquidity Analysis option is selected, then all the relevant data having the liquidity analysis (FQM_FLOW-OWNER = GCC) using the chain trace will be displayed. Customers having 'Full Scope' for the Cash and Liquidity Management can view this data.
    • If the Cash Position option is selected, then all the relevant Cash Position (FQM_FLOW-OWNER = POS) data will be displayed. Customers having Basic Scope or Full scope for the Cash and Liquidity Management can view this data.
      Scope for FI and Date indicator

  3. Date Indicator: There are two options available in the field 'Date Indicator', Value date and Posting date. I see lot of confusion about the value date and from where this date is taken. So, see below detail:
    • Value date is same as FQM_FLOW-TRANSACTION_DATE
    • Posting date is same as FQM_FLOW-POSTING_DATE

More information about app:

  1. Overdue column and first date column:
    • In older versions (till S4CORE 107), "Overdue" column will always be enabled. It is not a bug, but this is as per standard design. If users do not like to see the overdue balance taking into account in Cash Flow Analyzer, they can filter by certainty level = ACTUAL. But the column will remain and will be shown at the end.
    • It is not possible to see the amount in Overdue field with Value date less than today.
    • The amount in overdue column is sum of amounts having certainty levels MEMO, FICA, CMIDOC, TRM_O, TRM_D, SI_CIT for date less than entered in Date field.
    • The first data column after the Overdue column will have the sum from overdue column + any forecasted cash flow on that date.
    • Opening balance is zero in overdue column
    • If a user does not want to see the overdue amount in 1st Date field after the Overdue, then see in Delta View.
    • Also see KBA 2547319 - S/4Hana Cash Management: Cash Flow Analyzer or Cash Position details app balance summary.
      Overdue and First date column
  2. Navigation in the app:
    • When you are on application Cash Flow Analyzer Main view, in previous software releases (till S4CORE 1909) you were able to navigate to Check Cash Flow Items app directly. After upgrade, navigation happens from Cash Flow Analyzer to Display Cash Flow items list and from Cash Flow Items you can navigate to Check Cash Flow Items.

  3. Liquidity Item Update: Liquidity Item can be updated/changed manually using the app Check cash Flow Items. You can navigate from the app Cash Flow Analyzer to Check Cash Flow Items to do this.

  4. Hierarchies: There are multiple hierarchy options to display the data. Data can be displayed as per the hierarchy maintained.
    • Bank Account Hierarchy
    • Liquidity item hierarchy
      • When you navigate from the Bank Account Hierarchy to Liquidity item hierarchy, then only those data will be displayed in the Liquidity item hierarchy which also have bank details.
      • Opening/Closing balance cannot be seen directly in the Liquidity Item Hierarchy.
      • Also see KBA 3157646 Cash Flow Analyzer App: Liquidity Item Hierarchy View does not display Opening/Closing Balance.
    • Cash Concentration Simulation

Some common doubts/queries:

  • Why items under Bank Account unassigned?
    • If the field Technical ID (FQM_FLOW-BANK_ACCOUNT_ID) is not updated/have zeros in table FQM_FLOW, then the entries will come as unassigned in app Cash Flow Analyzer.
    • Also see KBA 2461437 - S/4 Hana Cash Management: In Cash Flow Analyzer APP ID F2332 Bank Account: Not Assigned appears / FQM_FLOW-BANK_ACCOUNT_ID not updated.

  • Why some items not in the Liquidity item hierarchy?
    • If no Liquidity Item is assigned in table FQM_FLOW, then it will come as unassigned in app Cash Flow Analyzer. In the Liquidity item hierarchy, it will come under the note #EMPTY.

  • If planning level is not updated for documents in table FQM_FLOW, data will not be displayed in transaction FF7AN/FF7BN. But data will be displayed in the app Cash Flow Analyzer, even when the planning level is not updated in table FQM_FLOW.

  • Some common issues:
    • KBA 3570660 - S/4 Hana Cash Management: Central KBA for Cash Flow Analyzer APP ID F2332 related issues

  • Some of the features/options mentioned here might not be available in all the release. The functions/features will be available based on the system release.

Hope after reading this blog post it will provide some useful insights about the app Cash Flow Analyzer. Feel free to provide your feedback, suggestions, questions in comments below and follow Vibha_Tiwary1 for future posts.

entry.title: Story variable not restricting data by category in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am facing an issue with variables in story in SAP Analytics Cloud. I am also a beginner here. I created a variable in the model (cat_tech) on the Category.ID dimension, with default value = Technology.

In the story, I also selected the variable and even get the input prompt when the story loads. However, even after choosing a value (e.g., Technology or Fitness), the table in my story still shows all categories instead of being restricted to the selected one.

Steps I followed,

  • Created the variable in the model (cat_tech → bound to Category.ID).

  • Set a default value (Technology).

  • In the story, I confirmed the variable prompt appears and I can select a different value.

  • After setting it, the dataset in the story still displays all categories (Technology, Food, Gaming, Travel, Fitness), instead of restricting to the chosen one.

I have attached screenshots. Of course, this is from a dummy dataset. I am also having problem with SAP BW dataset.

❓Am I missing something?

In ModelerIn Story

Thanks a lot for any guidance!

entry.title: Wrong Accounting Period in Depreciation Posting
entry.content:
Hello Everyone

During the depreciation calculation, I mistakenly processed August as period 8, which caused the depreciation for November to be executed.

In the depreciation processing function, if November is executed first, depreciation postings for the four months from August to November will be generated. After that, it is no longer possible to create the depreciation posting for August, since it has already been processed with the November posting.


If I handle this through reversal entries, do I need to register them one by one?
Or, if I just enter one fixed asset and process it, will everything be restored?

Does anyone here meet the same issue? Can you tell me the solution to this problem?

entry.title: Re: Multiple Delta Accrual on the Same Date
entry.content:
For your case, one straight and standard approach is to extend the Contract validity end date to 01.07.2025 or 4/5 days beyond. Run the Delta Accrual for 01.07.2025. Once the missed billing documents are accrued, revert the contract validity back to 30.06.2025 (if needed for audit or compliance).

For any reasons, if the above approach is not feasible, then, consider creating a new condition type for Rent to post the accrual manually. Once this is done, you can create a manual Delta Accrual document and add this custom condition type manually.

On the other hand, if the missed billing documents are significant and you want to populate in the final payout, then, run a Delta Settlement instead of Delta Accrual. Delta Settlement allows you to correct final settlement amounts based on late postings—even after the contract validity ends.

entry.title: Re: DATA Science
entry.content:
Great question 🙌 — SAP has been investing heavily in AI/ML integration, and you actually have multiple options depending on your use case:

  • SAP Business Application Studio (BAS): Works well if you want Jupyter Notebook-style development right inside SAP’s ecosystem. Ideal for quick prototyping in ML/NLP with Python.

  • SAP AI Core + AI Launchpad: This is SAP’s managed platform for training, deploying, and managing ML and Deep Learning models at scale.

  • SAP Data Intelligence: A good choice for orchestrating data pipelines and integrating ML models into enterprise workflows.

  • Data bricks + SAP Integration: Often used when teams want Spark-based ML/Deep Learning with seamless access to SAP data.

If you’re a student or fresher exploring this space, starting with BAS + Jupyter is a smoother entry point before scaling to AI Core/Data Intelligence. To strengthen your skills in parallel, structured learning like an artificial intelligence internship online can give you hands-on projects that complement SAP’s enterprise-level tools.

entry.title: Need latest C_ABAPD_2507 version
entry.content:
I’m happy to share that I’ve successfully passed the SAP Certified Associate – ABAP Development (C_ABAPD_2507) exam! 

For my preparation, I relied on a combination of trusted resources:

  • Official SAP Materials – including SAP Learning Hub and ABAP documentation, which provided a strong foundation in ABAP programming concepts, CDS views, OData, and integration with SAP S/4HANA.

  • ITExamspro – offered well-structured practice questions and mock tests that closely reflected the real exam style, giving me confidence on test day.

  • Community Resources – such as blogs, YouTube tutorials, and SAP Community discussions, which helped me understand practical use cases and real-world coding examples.

My focus areas were ABAP Core Data Services (CDS), ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), OData services, and ABAP on SAP HANA – as these are key topics in the exam.

entry.title: Re: Wrong Accounting Period in Depreciation Posting
entry.content: Incorrect depreciation expenses and accumulated depreciation values for multiple months, making your P&L and Balance Sheet completely inaccurate. Attempting manual journal entries to "fix" it without reversing the original transaction, leading to a tangled web of postings that is impossible to untangle Auditors would immediately flag this as a severe deficiency in financial controls, leading to a qualified audit opinion

entry.title: Re: which products are linked to the SAP RISE license (cl...
entry.content:
Hi Davi,

Sorry it unfortunately requires a bit of a long answer.

The terminology around RISE, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition changed significantly in around May 2025. As of May, RISE is no longer speaking to packages.

What used to be RISE packages with private edition in 2024 would be best matched to SAP Cloud ERP Private packages today, and what used to be GROW packages (GROW Base and GROW Premium) with public edition in 2024 would be best matched to what are called SAP Cloud ERP packages (Finance Base and Finance Premium) today.

If you want to know the contents of the packages with public and private editions at their heart, for a customer subscribing today - this blog gives you all you need:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/unpacking-the-new-sap-business-suite/ba-p/14191891

If you need information on a package a customer may have subscribed to prior to the changes (prior to April 2025 for packages with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and prior to May 2025 for packages with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) let me know and I can find additional information to share.

entry.title: Re: DRC eDocument Cockpit - Message EDOCUMENT006
entry.content:
Dear Sebastian

Error EDOCUMENT006 means EDOCUMENTHISTORY table is overloaded.

You cannot apply SAP Notes or make direct technical fixes in Public Cloud.

You can reset status using CPI or cancel the original invoice with VF11.

Only SAP Support can clear or extend EDOCUMENTHISTORY in Public Cloud.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Story variable not restricting data by category in SA...

entry.title: Re: Linking credit memo item mir4 with invoice item mir4...
entry.content: Wondering why you have added 'simple' to your post. On the surface, it seems simple, but linking a credit memo item to a specific invoice item within the same purchase order (PO) in MIR4 can be tricky. Both invoice and credit memo documents are posted against PO items, but they’re treated as separate financial postings. If you want to link a credit memo item to a specific invoice item, then, you can explore "reference document field" during posting. You can enter the invoice number that corresponds to PO item 10, in the 'reference document field'. This will link the credit memo to the original invoice.

entry.title: SAC – How to validate user-typed input in a Dropdown widget (not selected from list)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning mode and I have a Dropdown widget. Normally, users select values from the list, and I can get the key using Dropdown.getSelectedKey(). This Dropdown list's items are added by a fixed array of string on initialization, without default value.

However, I noticed that users can also type a value directly into the dropdown without choosing from the list. In this case:

  • Dropdown.getSelectedKey() returns nothing.

  • I cannot find a way to capture the typed input.

  • I want to check if the typed value exists in the dropdown list.

  • If it’s not valid, I would like to either show a warning message or clear the input.

My questions:

  1. How can I get the user’s typed input value (not just the selected key)?

  2. Is there a best practice in SAC to validate custom input against the dropdown list?

  3. Or if l can disable free text in a Dropdown widget?

Thanks for any help!

Iksuuu

@N1kh1l

entry.title: Re: Print 8D Report from Q2 Quality Notification
entry.content:
You can check in SPRO → Quality Management → Quality Notifications → Notification Processing → Tasks → Define Sort Sequences. Here, look for sort sequences relevant to your notification. Each sequence defines how tasks, activities, causes, etc., are grouped and displayed.

Next go to Quality Notifications → Notification Processing → Notification Types → Assign Sort Sequences to Notification Type. Here, ensure, your notification type Q2 is assigned the correct sort sequence.

Finally, go to Quality Notifications → Notification Processing → Codes → Define Codes for Tasks, Causes, Activities. Here, ensure that the codes used in your notification match those expected by the sort sequence.

entry.title: Re: 專案報工問題
entry.content:
Hi @MartinJou 

感谢您的提问。虽然回复稍晚，但希望仍能为您提供一些见解。

首先，我确认您的观察结果正确，这与SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版中的范围激活相关。若在客户的初始/质量/生产系统中仅显示“未分配员工的项目”而未出现“其他会计对象”，通常表明您尚未激活EPPM范围项。请通过“管理您的解决方案”→“查看解决方案范围”或在“中央业务配置”中进行启用。随后请检查是否已激活1NT项目控制（EPPM）、1A8项目财务和4I9项目管理与SAP S/4HANA Cloud。若这些范围未被激活，则不会显示“其他会计对象”选项。

要启用工时表集成，请确保“项目工时记录”集成已启用。此功能将工时表应用程序与EPPM对象关联。

请注意内部环境的系统差异：您的环境可能同时激活了PS和EPPM范围项，因此显示两个选项；而客户环境仅激活PS范围项，故仅显示“未分配员工项目”。

以下链接提供更多指引：

Manage My Timesheet

Scope Item 1NT Project Control (EPPM)

 

此致

克里斯

entry.title: Complete Guide to Setting Up Story Reports in SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Objective: Learn how to configure Story Reports in SAP SuccessFactors with step-by-step instructions, best practices, and troubleshooting tips.

Table of Contents:

  1. Introduction.
  2. Licensing Overview.
  3. Pre-Requisites for Story Reports.
  4. IPS Sync Configuration.
  5. Settings Role-Based Permissions for Story Report.
  6. Creating a Story Report
  7. Styling and Chart Configuration
  8. Common Issues and Fixes
  9. Conclusion and Community Tips

Introduction:

SAP SuccessFactors Story Reporting is a modern reporting solution that transforms traditional HR reporting into interactive, visual, and real-time analytics. It empowers users to create dynamic reports with rich visualizations.

Story reports are recommended to use due to their various benefits as visualized in the image below:

Licensing Overview:

  • Story Reporting is included with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central.
  •  However, Workforce Analytics (WFA) and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) require separate licenses.
  • Note that live payroll data reporting is not supported in Story Reports and may require third-party tools like Query Manager.

Pre-Requisites for Story Reports:

  • Go to Upgrade Center and activate 'Stories in People Analytics'.
  • Configure Identity Authentication Service (IAS) and Identity Provisioning Service (IPS).
  • Ensure user sync from SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) via IPS.

IPS Sync Configuration:

  • To perform the IPS Sync, navigate to “Target Systems” to enable the newly configured SAP Analytics Cloud tenant.
    • Select the target system à select the “Edit icon” à  choose “Enable” and on the confirmation pop-up message that appears, choose “OK”.  The status of the tenant changes to “Enabled”. 
    • Navigate to “Source Systems” and select your source “SAP SuccessFactors tenant”.
    • Go to --> Jobs tab --> Read Job type à choose --> Run Now.
    • You can track the progress of the read job from Job Logs.
    • When the read job is completed, the user sync from SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite to SAP Analytics Cloud is completed.

Settings RBP for Story Report:

  •    Create Story: Full access to create, edit, share and manage reports.
  • Story Admin: Manage all Story Reports and access 'All Reports' tab

  • Manage Integration Tools → Allow Admin to Access ‘OData API through Basic Authentication’
  • Manage User → Data Access: User (Ensure user data visibility)

Developing a Story report:

  1. Selecting a database: Below I have selected ‘Job information’ and ‘Personal Information’ as a combination and selected the columns I need.
  2. Click on the ‘save’ on top of left corner and once done selecting the columns you need to click ‘Finish’ on bottom right corner of the screen.
  3. In the below image, I have dragged ‘Job Information’ and ‘Personal Information’, In personal information, I have selected ‘Gender’ to include the field in my report.

As “Job Information and Personal information” are effective dated entities, system will ask the ‘start date’ or ‘effective date’ from which you want the data to be reflected in the report.

Naming the database. Here, I have kept the database name as ‘Job Information’.

Once the database is saved system will redirect you to the below screen. You can ‘Insert’ and drag & drop title in the below screen:

Here, on the right side of the screen, we have 2 sections, Builder – is for configurational use and Styling – where cosmetics change can be done for respective charts.

Builder sections: Below is an overview sections available in Builder to use while developing your story report.

  • Here we have data source names, in charts we have various options to select from, as per requirement.
  • Below I have selected a “Bar/Column” chart where I can select its orientation.
  • Then we have measures and dimensions which I have explained below in details.

To use various charts, we need to define ‘Measure’ and ‘Dimensions’. Which are important to build a story report.

  1. Measure: A measure is a quantitative value that you can perform calculations on, such as sums, averages, counts, or percentages.
    • Examples: Number of employees, Average performance rating, Total compensation, Headcount.
    • Usage: Measures are typically used in charts and tables to show trends, comparisons, or aggregations.
  2. Dimension: A dimension is a qualitative attribute used to categorize or group data. It provides context for measures. 

    Styling: In styling we have various features available as highlighted in left side of the below image. Widgets and legends are basic and most use features in styling section.

    • Widgets – where you can customize background colour, borders – style, width etc
    • Legends- where name of the dimensions are displayed, you can decide where to place your legend with options as – above, below and beside charts.

    Configuring a simple chart: Below, I have created a Bar/column chart, which is vertical in orientation. Measure is ‘Count’ (Employee count) and dimension is ‘Gender’. Colour for the bar/column chart can also be customised as per requirement. In the example, the instance is using 4 genders – Male(M), Female(F), undeclared(D)and unknown(U)

Common Issues and Fixes:

  1. For a user to be able to create Story Reports, their user information must be successfully synchronized to the SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) instance (as discussed earlier in the blog) and be assigned the appropriate RBP access. When this does NOT occur, the user is unable to create a new Story report or when creating a new story report, the webpage is stuck in a blank loading screen, or errors are displayed.
  2. Troubleshooting common issues via check tool: 
    1. SACDuplicateEmailValidationCheck:  
      • Purpose: This check identifies duplicate or unmapped email addresses in the system that are not linked to any user configured for Stories in People Analytics.
      • Email addresses are the primary key for user identification in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).
      • Duplicate or unmapped emails can cause login failures, reporting issues, or data inconsistencies in People Analytics.
    2. SACUserValidationCheckWithQuickFix
      1. Purpose: This check validates whether a user is correctly configured for Stories in People Analytics and offers a Quick Fix option if issues are detected.
      2. Ensures that users have the correct roles, permissions, and configurations to access Stories in People Analytics.
      3. Reduces dependency on manual troubleshooting by providing automated fixes.
    3. SACUserValidationCheck
      1. Purpose: This check verifies that a user record exists for Stories in People Analytics.
      2. Confirms that the user is present in the system, which is the first step before assigning roles or permissions.
      3. Prevents errors when granting access to People Analytics features.
         

    4. SAC connection error: In Check Tool when checked if the user exists in SAC and can see below error:

      1. The availability of the selected user couldn’t be confirmed for People Analytics, because of a connection error.
      2. To fix this we need to "Refresh SF Live Connection" and “x509 certificates” from Provisioning under "Configurations for Stories in People Analytics".

Conclusion:

Following these steps ensures a successful setup of Story Reports in SAP SuccessFactors. Share your experiences and tips in the comments to help others in the community.

entry.title: Starting My SAP Journey as a Real Estate Specialist (Immobilienkaufmann)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm just about to begin my apprenticeship as an Immobilienkaufmann (Real Estate Specialist) and I'm very eager to start learning SAP alongside my training. My goal is to become an expert in the field of real estate management using SAP, and I'm looking for a solid roadmap.

Are there any specific free courses or resources on the SAP Learning website that you would highly recommend for this career path?

Any personal experiences, tips, or professional advice would be incredibly valuable to me.

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: Brownfield Conversion: ECC Retail to S/4HANA Without...
entry.content: I guess, SAP does not support deactivating industry solutions like Retail during a brownfield conversion. If Retail is active in ECC, it will be carried forward into S/4HANA also. Attempting to convert without enabling Retail will result in incompatibility errors during the Simplification Item Check and SUM (Software Update Manager) phases. It is always better to check with SAP itself for such critical decisions. For some reasons, you don't to activate Retail in S/4HANA, then, consider Greenfield implementation.

entry.title: 🔵 AI Won't Take Your Job. But Someone Using it Might
entry.content:
AI is reshaping careers across industries — changing how work is organized, which skills matter most, and how teams deliver value. Roles are evolving, with some skills losing relevance and others becoming critical. For developers, this means more than just learning a new tool: it’s about rethinking how you solve problems, build solutions, and collaborate. This session explores the broad AI-driven trends affecting everyone, then zeroes in on what developers can do to adapt — from integrating AI into your workflow to sharpening the skills that AI can’t replace."

Speaker:

  • Timo Elliott

Timo Elliott is a speaker, moderator, and interviewer, interested in real-world impacts of tech. He is a “sliding sports” enthusiast, currently learning to wingfoil.

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud TM and WM Integration for Inboun...
entry.content:
Hello @ThomasSlack27 

While awaiting SAP’s note update, here are practical options currently used by customers in S/4HANA Public Cloud for inbound (PO) with TM/WM

Use ASR where available, TM -WM receiving

If your tenant releases and permits scope, Advanced Shipping & Receiving links TM freight orders to warehouse unloading and goods receipt (GR). Manage this process through Load or Unload Freight Orders and track progress in the ASR Cockpit. A key requirement is that the receiving point must be specified for the plant or storage location; without it, inbound processing in TM will be blocked.

Inbound focused on delivery without TM.

Several customers continue to handle transport planning outside S/4 HANA Public Cloud or manually and run inbound processes purely through Inbound Delivery and EWM.

  • Create an inbound delivery from the supplier ASN (EDI/Peppol/Ariba), then perform putaway in WM/EWM. This method serves as the simplest fallback when TM coupling isn’t required for receiving.

Synchronous Goods Receipt, no delivery, no TM

For chosen flows, post GR directly to the warehouse (scope 5HN). The system automatically creates and executes putaway tasks without requiring a delivery document, which is helpful when transport orchestration occurs outside S/4 HANA Public Cloud.

If your inbound is STO rather than a supplier PO

ASR for internal moves depends on the correct location and receiving point setup, enabling TM to plan accurately. If this applies to you, review the TM location determination guidance for STO enablement.

If you provide your release details, such as 2508, including whether it's inbound from a supplier PO or STO and the necessary transport modes, I can determine the best path (ASR, delivery-centric, or synchronous GR) along with the relevant apps and configuration touchpoints.

(GenAI assist content)The following official SAP Help Portal links and learning resources confirm the capabilities of inbound TM-WM integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud via Advanced Shipping & Receiving (ASR).

Advanced Shipping & Receiving (ASR) Overview-SAP Learning. This document provides a high-level overview of ASR, the overarching process that manages the entire product flow, including inbound scenarios.

Inbound Freight Unit Building (FUB)-SAP Help. This section explains how freight units can be automatically generated for inbound procurement documents, serving as the initial step for TM-WM integration.

Fiori Apps for ASR:-SAP Help. This app library entry explains the Fiori applications used to perform the ASR process, such as Load or Unload Freight Orders, which are essential for managing inbound receiving in the warehouse.

Prerequisites to Start Using Order-Based Planning with Flexible Master Data-SAP Help: This documentation highlights essential prerequisites for ASR, stressing the importance of EWM-managed locations and accurate master data configuration to prevent common integration problems.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Experimenting with AI-Enhanced ABAP Development Setup
entry.content: @SadiqManji: Joule for Developers is not an option, because SAP does not plan to release it for S/4HANA onPrem.

entry.title: Re: JSON not supported using the Datastore connection Web...
entry.content:
Hi @Kranthi_1987 ,

  1. Use SOAP UI to create a REST project and then export the REST project to a `wadl` file. 
  2. Make an API call to the endpoint and get the JSON response.
  3. Convert the JSON response to an XML response.
  4. Convert the XML response to an XSD
  5. Modify the `wadl` file and add the <grammars></grammars> section.
  6. Inside the <grammars></grammars> section insert the XSD in step 4.
  7. Make sure that the  request and response sections of the `wadl` are setup correctly.
  8. In SAP Data Services designer create a Web Service REST Datastore and the URL to the web service should be the path to the wadl file.
  9. Then import the REST functions and build your jobs.

References

Web Application Description Language

entry.title: Enhancing Unit Testing in SAP CAP Java Applications with GitHub Copilot
entry.content:
Introduction
Building upon SAP's guide to unit testing in CAP Java, this post explores how GitHub Copilot can streamline and accelerate the process of writing unit tests in SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) Java projects.

GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered coding assistant developed by GitHub and OpenAI. It helps developers by suggesting code snippets, functions, and even entire test cases in real time, based on the context of what you're writing. Integrated into popular code editors, it speeds up development and reduces repetitive tasks.

Where GitHub Copilot Helps
GitHub Copilot assists by:

  1. Autocompleting test scaLolds
  2. Suggesting assertion logic
  3. Handling repetitive boilerplate (e.g., mocks and setup)
  4. Speeding up TDD cycles (Red → Green → Refactor)

How GitHub Copilot Can Help in Writing TDD Test Cases

In the context of SAP CAP Java, GitHub Copilot streamlines the process of writing unit tests, allowing developers to focus on defining behaviour and business logic.
Below we will demonstrate the example using a test case from SAP's guide to unit testing in CAP Java. The test case is part of the method “validateBookAndDecreaseStock” , which was introduced and tested manually in this post.

Let’s now see how GitHub Copilot helps implement the same scenario using a TDD approach, covering prompts, completions, and code refinements.

Scenario: Book Does Not Exist - We want to write a test for the case where a book ID in an order does not exist in the database.

  1. Red – Write the Failing Test First

    Prompt Example:

    "Write a JUnit 5 test for validateBookAndDecreaseStock(List<OrderItems>) when the book does not exist. Mock the persistence service to return empty result. Expect Service Exception with message – Book does not exist"

    Copilot Suggestion:


    This gives us a strong starting point — the structure, mocking, and assertions are generated instantly. We can now refine or expand it as needed.

  2.  Green – Implement Minimal Code to Pass the Test

    Once the test is in place and failing, we write just enough application code to make it pass.
    How Copilot Helps:
    • Copilot can suggest the implementation stub or completion for the service method.
    • It recognizes context (e.g., entity names like Books, usage of persistence Service, and typical CAP patterns).

    Prompt Example:

    “Implement the validateBookAndDecreaseStock method so it throws a Service Exception when the book is not found.”


    Copilot Suggestion:


    While still minimal, this satisfies the failing test and progresses the TDD loop.

  3.  Refactor – Clean and Improve Code

    Once the test passes, the code can be cleaned up. Copilot can assist by:
    1. Suggesting improved variable naming

    2. Identifying reusable logic (e.g., extracting methods)
    3. Completing more idiomatic Java or CAP Java constructs

    Prompt Example:

    "Refactor validateBookAndDecreaseStock to extract book lookup into a separate private method."

    Copilot Suggestion:


    GitHub Copilot provides several other ways to improve our development workflow. Below is a table showcasing additional use cases and how it can support us throughout the process:


    Way Copilot Helps

    Description

    Prompting

    Provides code suggestions based on the context of your work, helping you quickly generate code snippets and complete tasks.

    Auto-completion

    Suggests auto-completions for common code patterns like variable declarations, method signatures, or class instantiations, reducing the need to write repetitive code.

    Refactoring Suggestions

    Suggests improvements in code structure, like method extraction or renaming variables, for cleaner and more maintainable code.

    Context-Aware Suggestions

    Generates code that fits with the specific libraries or frameworks you're using, ensuring adherence to best practices.

    Error Handling Recommendations

    Helps identify and handle potential exceptions or edge cases by suggesting relevant error handling and assertions.

     

Conclusion

In conclusion, GitHub Copilot significantly enhances the unit testing process in SAP CAP Java applications by providing real-time code suggestions, automating repetitive tasks, and ensuring comprehensive test coverage. By streamlining the creation of test cases, mocking dependencies, and improving code structure, Copilot accelerates the TDD workflow, allowing developers to focus more on business logic and less on boilerplate code. Its ability to suggest improvements and handle edge cases ultimately leads to cleaner, more maintainable code and a more efficient development process.

Disclaimer

The views and opinions expressed in this blog post are those of the author and do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of SAP or its affiliates. This content is provided for informational purposes only, based on the author's personal experience and understanding.

This blog references the use of GitHub Copilot, an AI-powered coding assistant. The suggestions generated by Copilot are not guaranteed to be accurate, complete, secure, or compliant with any specific coding standards or organizational policies. Developers are responsible for reviewing, validating, and testing all code before use in any production or sensitive environment.

SAP makes no representations or warranties, express or implied, regarding the suitability or accuracy of the information or tools mentioned herein.

entry.title: Shifting Table Data Based on Parameter Value
entry.content:
Hello team!
I have this table, and I want the data to shift forward based on the value I define in a parameter. For example, if I set the parameter to 2, all the data in the table should move forward by 2 months, and the first 2 months should be set to 0.
Is it possible to do this?

I tried using this code. It shifts the months according to the value I set in the parameter, but then it sets everything to 0:

 

DATA(
[d/Measures] = "Valor",
[d/Date] = NEXT(%PMR%, "MONTH")
) = RESULTLOOKUP(
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
)
 
DATA(
[d/Date] = PREVIOUS(%PMR%,"MONTH",[d/Date]),
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
) = 0

entry.title: Re: SAC – How to validate user-typed input in a Dropdown...
entry.content:
@iksuuu 

If the user is typing the values, to make it selected either he has to hit enter or select manually by Mouse. Else this selection will not get captured.

Case 1: Typed  and clicked Outside

Case 2: Typed and either hit enter or used mouse to make selection.

Hope this helps. Explain the user that just typing wont make the selection, either hit enter or use mouse gesture to select.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Shifting Table Data Based on Parameter Value
entry.content:
@Carvalho_A1 

Its deleting everything as you are asking it to do so. You are executing the below for all dates shifted 2 periods back.

DATA(
[d/Date] = PREVIOUS(%PMR%,"MONTH",[d/Date]),
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
) = 0
 
Better you delete shifting 2 periods forward from first month.
// First shift the values
DATA(
[d/Measures] = "Valor",
[d/Date] = NEXT(%PMR%, "MONTH")
) = RESULTLOOKUP(
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
)
//Now Delete, Assuming %PMR% is type Integer
IF MONTH([d/Date]) <=%PMR% THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "Valor") = 0
ENDIF
Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Customer/Vendor Address Data Cleansing with SAP DQM (Data Quality Management)
entry.content:
Absolutely! Address data is one of those tricky little details that can silently derail a project if it’s inconsistent. When migrating to S/4HANA, even minor differences in spelling, formatting, or country codes can create headaches that slow everything down.

What’s fascinating is how addressing these inconsistencies highlights the real power of Data Quality Practices. By validating addresses against trusted reference sources and applying proper formatting rules, you’re not just “fixing errors”, you’re creating a foundation where all other processes can run smoothly. It’s like cleaning up a messy workspace before starting an important task; everything flows better once the basics are solid.

It’s a great reminder that in data projects, the smallest things matter. Taking the time to get addresses right isn’t just a checkbox, it’s a step that makes the entire migration more predictable, accurate, and efficient. The little things really do make a big difference! This is exactly where PiLog’s Data Quality Management comes in, helping organizations systematically ensure that addresses and other critical master data are accurate, standardized, and ready for a smooth migration.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors Learning
entry.content:
Hi @Matthew_Knight 

Depending on what needs to be updated, the Import Data tool can be used. Please note that completion dates & times can't be changed massively (2449530).

Other than the above, there is no tool nor configuration that allows a mass update / deletion of Learning History records (2436676). But it can be done manually, one by one (2340618).

In case your team requires a mass update / deletion that can't be achieved by the standard tools and options available, then it's necessary to engage SAP Professional Services team (2149831) to check the possibility of having a script executed.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Evaluating SAP’s new MCP servers: UI5, CAP, and Fiori tools in practice
entry.content:
Hey Marian, Thanks for the great overview and feedback! Quick info regarding the errors you experienced with the UI5 MCP Server:

The server currently relies on the UI5 CDN for fetching some of the necessary resources for the API reference tool (we plan to move this to npm in the future). It seems like your first project is unfortunately using a rather outdated version of UI5. Version "1.108.1" is over one year old and therefore got removed from the CDN [1]. Upgrading to the latest "1.108.45" release in your ui5.yaml should resolve this. We will improve the error message there.

Regards your Fiori Elements app, I believe you found a bug affecting projects without any framework configuration in their ui5.yaml. We just released a fix for that [2]. You can try it using v0.1.1 of the package.

I hope this can help you to get things working! If not, and also for any other feedback, please let us know over at https://github.com/UI5/mcp-server/issues or reach out on the usual channels 😊

Thanks again!

[1] https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/removing-outdated-ui5-versions-from-ui5-cdn/bc-p/13954871
[2] https://github.com/UI5/mcp-server/pull/18

entry.title: Re: Asset APC value in AR02 report double
entry.content: The transaction for the Asset Balances report is AR01, not AR02. The Asset History Sheet is AR02.

entry.title: Exploring Salesforce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Overview - As part of my recent Migration project from MuleSoft to SAP, I was able to explore the salesforce adapter. Sharing across the adapter configuration - which can be helpful for other project's use cases. 

Pre-reading - 

Overview | Salesforce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

sObject Types | Apex Developer Guide | Salesforce Developers

SOQL SELECT Syntax | SOQL and SOSL Reference | Salesforce Developers

Pre-requisites - 

  • OAuth Client Credentials are deployed in tenant 
  • Connectivity is working with salesforce 

Basic PoC Flow -

 

Please find configuration of the adapter for different CRUD operation :

Operation 1 : SOQL Execute query

Fetches the data based on the query passed, one can select the payload as xml or json based on the interface requirement.

Operation 2 : CREATE - Custom Salesforce Object is being used. 

Operation 3 : DELETE with External ID

 

Operation 4 : UPDATE - Custom Salesforce Object is being used. Upsert payload is set in content modifier in step ahead of SF adapter.

Operation 5 : UPSERT  with External ID - Custom Salesforce Object is being used. Upsert payload is being sent in the field External ID Value. External ID Name consists of the mandatory key. 

For custom object SD_Job_Activity__c as seen below Id is the key in the Salesforce

The upsert payload needs to be in single object format. Sample Reference upsert payload shared below -

   {

      "SD_DCFR_Sync_Action__c":"None",

      "SD_DCFR_Sync_Status__c":"Synced",

      "SD_DCFR_GUID__c":"2f13ffdc-4101-434b-b94d-300a7c70e4c5",

      "Id":"aEzDw00000006zSKAQ",

      "SD_DCFR_Sync_Message__c":"Activity created successfully in DCFR |  | Crew Details missing in the payload"

   }

Alternatively, One can use salesforce objects - composite - for multiple records update scenario.

entry.title: Re: S4 brownfield migration, having ABST2 differences in...
